definition: to set up separately/to establish separate units

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: Committee was divided four function groups.
sentences.chinese: 委员会分设以下四个功能小组。

sentences.english: And the schools shall not divide the classes into key and non-key classes.
sentences.chinese: 学校不得分设重点班和非重点班。

definition: to add to existing facilities or services
(of an organization etc) standing or permanent
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
located at/set up in a particular location
to offer (goods or services)/to open (for business etc)
to belong to (a category)/to be attached to
